unnormalised: The Indian Railways announced changes to several train schedules effective 01/01/2025, impacting commuters nationwide. The modifications are aimed at improving punctuality and optimizing resource allocation. Passengers are advised to check the updated timetables on the IRCTC website or mobile app.
normalised: The Indian Railways announced changes to several train schedules effective first January two thousand and twenty five, impacting commuters nationwide. The modifications are aimed at improving punctuality and optimizing resource allocation. Passengers are advised to check the updated timetables on the I-R-C-T-C website or mobile app.

unnormalised: Key changes include the Howrah Mail, which will now depart at 22:00 hrs instead of 22:30 hrs. Similarly, the Rajdhani Express from Delhi to Mumbai will be preponed by 1 hour, with a new departure time of 16:00 hrs. The Chennai Express, however, will experience a delay of approximately 45 mins, departing at 07:15 hrs.
normalised: Key changes include the Howrah Mail, which will now depart at twenty two hundred hours instead of twenty two thirty hours. Similarly, the Rajdhani Express from Delhi to Mumbai will be preponed by one hour, with a new departure time of sixteen hundred hours. The Chennai Express, however, will experience a delay of approximately forty five minutes, departing at zero seven fifteen hours.

unnormalised: These adjustments are part of a larger effort to streamline railway operations and minimize disruptions. The Railways have requested passengers to take note of these changes to avoid any inconvenience. For detailed information, passengers can call the helpline number 139 or visit their nearest railway station.
normalised: These adjustments are part of a larger effort to streamline railway operations and minimize disruptions. The Railways have requested passengers to take note of these changes to avoid any inconvenience. For detailed information, passengers can call the helpline number one thirty nine or visit their nearest railway station.
